blog.title: Let's Discuss this Latest Buffoonery

I identify as me. Autistic. Gender identity is halfway between 'ambiguous' and 'running gag.' I think I'm funny.  I sometimes rant about history and autism.
Currently writing a novel and trying to stay employed.

summary: So this dumbass meme I made yesterday morning has more likes than PETA’s original post. My roommate says she saw the meme on her...
caption:
So this dumbass meme I made yesterday morning has more likes than PETA’s original post.

My roommate says she saw the meme on her Tumblr dash and I am extremely proud.

For the record, I don’t mind that people are using my meme on here at all (and I don’t need credit for it, since it’s just a silly recaption anyway).  I just figured I should share my delight at its success.

summary: Any tips for designing gijinkas? Seriously your designs are the best. Your redraws had me blown away
question: Any tips for designing gijinkas? Seriously your designs are the best. Your redraws had me blown away
answer:
Thank you so much!!! QuQ  
I’m happy you enjoy my gijinkas, even if I don’t draw them as often anymore. Always fun to go back to my roots tho.

Man gijinka design is tricky cuz there’s so many different ways you can approach the design process. You can make them completely human, give them pokemon characteristics (like tails, ears or wings) or make them well … humanoid pokemon i guess???

What flavor you want to go for is entirely up to you but I’m just gonna tell you what my usual design process is like.
I prefer gijinkas that look human and the only thing that really mirrors the original design are the clothes. So the questions I have to ask are

1. What kinda character is is supposed to be? I need a basic understanding of what kind of personality they’re supposed to have.

How does the character present themselves, in their posture, their expression, their overall personality. These are important things to consider. I kinda felt like I was sorta lacking in this department for a while but I do feel like I’ve gotten better at this again.

2. What theme should the outfit have? Should they be a wallflower or sexy, retro or futuristic, business or casual, based on our current fashion or completely otherworldly?

Should be self explenatory. Giving them a normal ass t-shirt and jeans is fine but WHAT IF you do something a little more extra. Cuz extra is fun.

Some examples

Casual

Futuristic

Whole ass 18th century pre french revolution dress 

3. How can I incorpate the original design into my chosen theme?

Once you’ve got that basic theme down, it’s time to make the gijinka look like the actual pokemon. In this category you can go hog wild on some thing and very calculated on other thing. There is no right or wrong here either. 

You wanna give your Honchkrow that hat cuz it’s on the pokemon? Give them that hat
You wanna make that hat into a wild hairdo instead? Fuck yea fam, go right ahead.

Shuffle around the design aspects. They don’t have to be in the places the pokemon has them. If I would have put Guzzlord’s grabby tentacles into the mouth of the dress, that woudl ahve been way too busy. But hey! How about a shoulder scarf? Fuck yes. And you can still see what aspects of the design it should represent.

That’s about all I can say. Good look with designing!

Have a good sheep
